page.title: 13Calstock Church-Tamar Valley
page.content: Calstock parish church, St. Andrew's, is in the south eastern corner of our twelve squares. A part of the church is six hundred years old. It has been extended and you can see this by the different patterns on the pillars. One of the interesting features is the letter from Charles 1, written at the time of the Civil War, thanking the people of Cornwall for their support. There are two other church of England churches in our area, St.Ann's is at Gunnislake and All Saints is at Harrowbarrow. On Sundays, in the 3 churches Cannon Ruming, the rector, holds 4 services altogether. At Calstock 50-60 people attend the morning service and about 25 in the evening.
